State to snoop on your sex life with probing questions about promiscuity and contraception
 http://www.dailymail.co.uk/pages/live/articles/news/news.html?in_article_id=560771&in_page_id=1770&ct=5
When it appears in a more reputable source then I might get concerned.

How's about the Office of National Statistics?
 http://www.statistics.gov.uk/about/Consultations/ONS_consultations/downloads/IHSConsultResponse.pdf
 It does sound like a wind-up, but this government would.
 
 The lists of topics in the survey are in Annex B on page 35.
 There are links in Annex C on page 38.

Well, that document suggests that it is simply an amalgam of surveys they already do, and there is nothing I can see that says that answering is compulsory. If you don't want to answer the questions just say "no". It's not like it's the census or anything.

The article does state that the survey is voluntary, from the ONS report it appears that the plan is to do it face to face.
 Why would the government want to know about contraception use though?
 Bizare...

The article does state that the survey is voluntary, from the ONS report it appears that the plan is to do it face to face.
 Why would the government want to know about contraception use though?
 Bizare...

 
 To asses the effectivness of their Sexual Health strategy?

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  They want to know what???
